DOC.brief_summary: Tissue injury associate pain injured site ( primary hyperalgesia ) pain non-injured tissue vicinity trauma ( secondary hyperalgesia ) . In present study investigate primary secondary hyperalgesia healthy volunteer follow experimental first degree burn injury . The objective : - compare analgesic anti-hyperalgesic effect two opioids ( morphine buprenorphine ) . - investigate effect related volunteer individual pain sensitivity
DOC.detailed_description: Please refer : Ravn P , Secher EL , Skram U , Therkildsen T , Christrup LL , Werner MU ( 2013 ) Morphine- buprenorphine-induced analgesia antihyperalgesia human inflammatory pain model : double-blind , randomize , placebo-controlled , five-arm crossover study . J Pain Res 6 : 23-38 . 10.2147/JPR.S36827 [ doi ] ; jpr-6-023 [ pii ] .
DOC.criteria: healthy individual adequate psychomotor performance perform pain test painsensitive painnonsensitive accord prespecified criterion know allergy morphine buprenorphine prior adverse experience opioids history abuse females take Ppills skin lesion testsites suffer chronic pain medication analgesic BMI > 28 smoker
